name: Senator Angus King
tweet_text: As President Lincoln said: it‚Äôs time to rise with the occasion.

name: Senator Angus King
tweet_text: I believe that President Biden has the opportunity, the ability, and the character to unify our nation and make this government work for its people. Now, Congress must do its part, and come together on a bipartisan basis to improve the country we all love so dearly.

name: Senator Angus King
tweet_text: More than 150 years later, it‚Äôs impossible to summarize this moment in American history, or the proper response, any better than Lincoln did. It‚Äôs time to think anew, and act anew, because we cannot allow our usual petty squabbles to hinder our response to the threats we face.

name: Senator Angus King
tweet_text: He said: ‚ÄòThe dogmas of the quiet past are inadequate to the stormy present. The occasion is piled high with difficulty and we must rise with the occasion. As our case is new, we must think anew and act anew. We must disenthrall ourselves, and then we shall save our country.‚Äô

name: Senator Angus King
tweet_text: At this urgent juncture, I find myself turning to the words one of our nation‚Äôs greatest citizens. As President Abraham Lincoln worked to preserve the Union during its most delicate time, he urged Congress to rise to the moment.

name: Senator Angus King
tweet_text: A divided nation, where a few conflict-seeking voices on the fringes seem to drown out the majority who long for compromise. In the middle of these crises and more, we cannot simply settle into business-as-usual.

name: Senator Angus King
tweet_text: Our nation is facing immense challenges. A pandemic that has already killed nearly 400,000 Americans, and still grows worse by the day. A foundering economy that is forcing too many Americans to make unimaginable choices.

name: Senator Angus King

name: Senator Angus King
tweet_text: One last note: our report is *completely unclassified* because improving cybersecurity can‚Äôt just happen behind closed doors in Washington. It requires work from each of us. I hope you‚Äôll give it a read, and urge your elected officials to act on cyber before it‚Äôs too late.

name: Senator Angus King
tweet_text: These are just a few of our recommendations ‚Äì and by no means is our list exhaustive. We concluded some debates without reaching a consensus, and in this ever-shifting sphere there will be new challenges to face that we can‚Äôt yet imagine. But this is a very good place to start.

name: Senator Angus King
tweet_text: ‚û°Ô∏èWe need the American people to be able to stay vigilant, and that starts with helping them understand foreign interference. The government should support digital literacy, civics education, and public awareness of malign foreign efforts.

name: Senator Angus King
tweet_text: ‚û°Ô∏èThe team at @CISAGov is doing important work already, and we need to elevate their efforts by giving the agency the authorities and funding it needs to reach its full potential.

name: Senator Angus King
tweet_text: ‚û°Ô∏èCongress should establish a Senate-confirmed National Cyber Director within the executive branch. With cyber touching so many aspects of our lives (and government), we need someone at the highest level who can wrangle all the federal agencies to move the ball forward.

name: Senator Angus King
tweet_text: ‚û°Ô∏èCongress should create House Permanent Select and Senate Select Committees. Right now, cyber responsibility is diluted across committees, creating a sometimes insurmountable obstacle to progress. We can‚Äôt let Congressional bureaucracy impede necessary action.

name: Senator Angus King
tweet_text: To help enact these layers, we‚Äôve created six pillars of deterrence and more than 75 specific recommendations focused on improving security in both the public and private sectors. Some of our key findings:

name: Senator Angus King
tweet_text: There is no silver bullet here, but there may be silver buckshot. America needs to pursue layered cyber deterrence by enhancing our defenses at home, reducing benefits for those who would try to exploit our cyber vulnerabilities, and imposing costs for those who cross the line.

name: Senator Angus King
tweet_text: The CSC brought together bipartisan Members of Congress ‚Äì including my co-chair @RepGallagher, @SenSasse, and @JimLangevin ‚Äì top executive branch officials, and industry leaders, drawing from the different perspectives we need to face this pressing challenge head on.

name: Senator Angus King
tweet_text: To be blunt: we are dangerously insecure in cyberspace, even as we become more reliant on it. Everything from your bank account to your health records to your electricity relies on cyber; but America has serious vulnerabilities that, when exploited, inflict lasting damage.

name: Senator Angus King
tweet_text: For a year, the @CyberSolarium has worked to review the threats America faces in cyberspace and provide recommendations on how to address them. Today, we‚Äôre releasing our report, which we hope will help guide the country in the years ahead. Read: https://t.co/ViDnPftEuG
